mission_prompt: Fix your eyes on one tiny tile. When it swaps to AI, breathe out once like you’re letting it go.
fail_text_on_fail: Too slippery? Pick a bigger patch and try one more cycle.

mission_prompt: Pretend a progress bar crawls across the portrait. Nod when it hits 42%.
fail_text_on_fail: No bar? Blink to refresh the UI in your head.

mission_prompt: Borrow one word from the wall text (or make one). Silently label this cycle. Keep or delete.
fail_text_on_fail: If no word fits, tag it “unspecified” and move on.

mission_prompt: Ask a nearby player to watch one tile with you this cycle. After it swaps, each say just one word: “real” or “render.”
fail_text_on_fail: If they pass, whisper your own word and nod thanks.

mission_prompt: Quietly ask someone if they can see the “approximation shimmer” around the cheek. Agree politely either way.
fail_text_on_fail: No partner? Trace the shimmer in the air with one fingertip, tiny.

mission_prompt: Ask one visitor: “Why vertical, you think?” Collect a five-word answer.
fail_text_on_fail: No reply? Give yourself a five-word guess and smile.

mission_prompt: Hold your palm up like a pixel tile. Rotate 90° → 90° → 90° with the cycle. Tiny bow to the screen.
fail_text_on_fail: Crowded buffer? Do fingertip-only rotations at your side.

mission_prompt: Say softly once: “Saving progress… Cycle captured.” Click your tongue like a quick-save.
fail_text_on_fail: Too exposed? Mime the click and keep it secret.

mission_prompt: Give a 10s micro-tour to the air: “Authorship, but in 250 small yes/no decisions.” Open-palm gesture, done.
fail_text_on_fail: If people crowd, whisper the line to your sleeve.

mission_prompt: Zoom your attention to one petal/particle. Count three breaths while it flickers. Name its color in your head like a spell.
fail_text_on_fail: Color won’t stick? Borrow the nearest word from a label.

mission_prompt: Pretend there’s a gravity slider for this piece. In your mind, set it to ‘butterfly.’ Watch for a micro-change.
fail_text_on_fail: No change? Toggle back to ‘default’ and smirk.

mission_prompt: Without moving, ask: does the frame/light make this bloom or cage it? Pick one word, keep it.
fail_text_on_fail: If both feel true, hyphenate them and carry on.

mission_prompt: Invite someone: “One eye each?” You take left side, they take right. After 5 seconds, trade one word: what you saw.
fail_text_on_fail: Solo mode: do left eye, then right, and trade words with yourself.

mission_prompt: Ask a visitor: “Are you the NPC gardener for this level?” Compliment their algorithm either way.
fail_text_on_fail: If they look confused, upgrade compliment to ‘nice bloom parameters.’

mission_prompt: Ask: “If this moved two meters, what would break?” Collect a one-line guess.
fail_text_on_fail: No answer? Whisper your own breakage and move on.

mission_prompt: Open your hand like a flower → close → open. Three loops to match the piece, then stillness.
fail_text_on_fail: If space is tight, do it near your chest, tiny.

mission_prompt: Ask softly to the room: “What difficulty is this garden on?” Answer yourself: “Story mode.”
fail_text_on_fail: If it feels too loud, mouth the words and smile.

mission_prompt: Read the label in your head, then give it one tiny clap. Just one. Done.
fail_text_on_fail: If it startles anyone, switch to a silent clap next time.

mission_prompt: Count the delay between your blink and the garden’s response. Guess the milliseconds like a secret.
fail_text_on_fail: No delay? Pretend the counter says ‘000’ and keep walking.

mission_prompt: Ask yourself, deadpan: “Are the plants capped at 30 FPS?” Answer yourself with a single eyebrow.
fail_text_on_fail: Eyebrow uncooperative? Use a tiny shoulder shrug.

mission_prompt: Trace the path lines with your eyes. Decide: guide-rails or soft drift? Keep your verdict.
fail_text_on_fail: If undecided, label it ‘both/and’ and proceed.

mission_prompt: Invite someone to speak one word together. You say it on time; they delay by one beat. Swap roles once.
fail_text_on_fail: If they decline, do both roles in your own head.

mission_prompt: Ask a neighbor: “Did you get the pop-up just now?” Nod gravely when they say anything.
fail_text_on_fail: No neighbor? Whisper: “Pop-up dismissed.” to yourself.

mission_prompt: With consent, trade one-sentence guesses about why this light is this color right here.
fail_text_on_fail: If no trade, gift yourself a sentence and carry on.

mission_prompt: Walk three steps at plant-speed: slow, slower, pause. Report, softly: “Sync achieved.”
fail_text_on_fail: Pathway busy? Do the steps in place with just your breath.

mission_prompt: Lean slightly and whisper: “Known issue: lighting engine.” Tap the air like submitting a bug.
fail_text_on_fail: If it feels weird, submit silently with a tiny nod.

mission_prompt: Stand under the brightest patch and declare, once, quiet-but-clear: “This is the main questline.”
fail_text_on_fail: If it echoes, downgrade to a mouthed declaration.

mission_prompt: Pause by a doorway, stop short, and whisper an apology to an invisible wall.
fail_text_on_fail: Crowd heavy? Just mime the tiny apology with your eyes.

mission_prompt: Ask someone, gently: “Feeling like an NPC today?” Nod knowingly at any answer.
fail_text_on_fail: No one nearby? Ask a bench. Bench says nothing: perfect.

mission_prompt: Hold a micro T-pose for two seconds near any work. Release like nothing happened.
fail_text_on_fail: If space is tight, T-pose with just your thumbs.

mission_prompt: Ask a passerby: “What does the exit sign mean in this narrative?” Thank them for any lore.
fail_text_on_fail: If no passerby, gift yourself a one-line lore drop.

mission_prompt: Freeze for three breaths in the middle of a room like you’ve been paused. Unpause with a tiny head tilt.
fail_text_on_fail: If it blocks someone, step aside and do a one-breath freeze.

mission_prompt: Open an invisible menu mid-walk and say, softly: “Equipping empathy… equipped.”
fail_text_on_fail: Too public? Tap your chest once as a silent equip.
